Uses of Interface
com.newmainsoftech.spray.sprex.web.servlet.config.ViewResolverDefinitionInjectorCase

  • Packages that use ViewResolverDefinitionInjectorCase 
    Package Description
    com.newmainsoftech.spray.sprex.web.servlet.config  

    • Uses of ViewResolverDefinitionInjectorCase in com.newmainsoftech.spray.sprex.web.servlet.config

      Classes in com.newmainsoftech.spray.sprex.web.servlet.config that implement ViewResolverDefinitionInjectorCase 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  ViewResolverDefinitionInjector
      Default implementation of ViewResolverDefinitionInjectorCase interface to adds view resolver beans to application context.
      This is developed due to that BeanDefinitionRegistryPostProcessor and PostConstruct does not work (broken) with @Configuration of Spring' JavaConfig (but BeanFactoryPostProcessor.) For more info regarding this issue, refer to https://jira.springsource.org/browse/SPR-8269 http://forum.springsource.org/showthread.php?56712-PostConstruct-and-PreDestroy-in-JavaConfig https://jira.springsource.org/browse/SPR-7868 http://forum.springsource.org/showthread.php?56712-PostConstruct-and-PreDestroy-in-JavaConfig This implementation add the following view resolver beans: BeanNameViewResolver bean
      Adding BeanNameViewResolver bean by default because, as nature of JavaConfig, BeanNameViewResolver became to make more sense than XML config era.
      Methods in com.newmainsoftech.spray.sprex.web.servlet.config that return ViewResolverDefinitionInjectorCase 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ViewResolverDefinitionInjectorCase ViewResolverConfig.viewResolverDefinitionInjector()
      Instantiating ViewResolverDefinitionInjectorCase bean adds other view resolvers to application context.
      The ViewResolverDefinitionInjector (default implementation of ViewResolverDefinitionInjectorCase interface) will add the following view resolver beans: BeanNameViewResolver bean
      Adding BeanNameViewResolver bean by default because, as nature of JavaConfig, BeanNameViewResolver became to make more sense than XML config era.
